docs.snippet: Hungary says Prime Minister Viktor Orban has been invited to visit Russian President Vladimir Putin on Feb. 17....
docs.lead_paragraph: Hungary says Prime Minister Viktor Orban has been invited to visit Russian President Vladimir Putin on Feb. 17.

headline.main: Hungary's Orban Invited to Feb. 17 Meeting With Putin
headline.print_headline: Hungary's Orban Invited to Feb. 17 Meeting With Putin

docs.snippet: A former Polish dissident and his daughter agree with an editorial condemning recent anti-democratic measures in Poland....
docs.lead_paragraph: A former Polish dissident and his daughter agree with an editorial condemning recent anti-democratic measures in Poland.

docs.snippet: There will be no Syria peace talks if the government does not take humanitarian steps outlined by the U.N. Security Council, including a halt to attacks on civilians and an end to blockades, the opposition's chief negotiator said on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: There will be no Syria peace talks if the government does not take humanitarian steps outlined by the U.N. Security Council, including a halt to attacks on civilians and an end to blockades, the opposition's chief negotiator said on Thursday.

headline.main: 'Zero Chance' of Syria Talks Without Goodwill Steps From Damascus-Opposition Negotiator
headline.print_headline: 'Zero Chance' of Syria Talks Without Goodwill Steps From Damascus-Opposition Negotiator

docs.snippet: Syrian peace talks will go ahead in Geneva, U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry insisted on Thursday, but with just days to go, rival camps bickered about who should be invited to take part....
docs.lead_paragraph: Syrian peace talks will go ahead in Geneva, U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry insisted on Thursday, but with just days to go, rival camps bickered about who should be invited to take part.

headline.main: With Days to Go, Rival Camps Bicker Over Teams for Syria Peace Talks
headline.print_headline: With Days to Go, Rival Camps Bicker Over Teams for Syria Peace Talks

docs.snippet: Billionaire investor George Soros told Bloomberg TV on Thursday he sees a hard landing for China's economy contributing to global deflation....
docs.lead_paragraph: Billionaire investor George Soros told Bloomberg TV on Thursday he sees a hard landing for China's economy contributing to global deflation.

headline.main: George Soros Says He Expects Hard Landing for China Economy: Bloomberg
headline.print_headline: George Soros Says He Expects Hard Landing for China Economy: Bloomberg

docs.snippet: Turkish Prime Minister Ahmet Davutoglu accused Russia on Thursday of jeopardizing peace talks on Syria planned for next week by insisting on the inclusion of "terrorist groups" such as the Kurdish YPG militia on the opposition side....
docs.lead_paragraph: Turkish Prime Minister Ahmet Davutoglu accused Russia on Thursday of jeopardizing peace talks on Syria planned for next week by insisting on the inclusion of "terrorist groups" such as the Kurdish YPG militia on the opposition side.

headline.main: Turkish PM Says No Role for 'Terrorist Groups' in Syria Talks
headline.print_headline: Turkish PM Says No Role for 'Terrorist Groups' in Syria Talks

docs.snippet: Britain's judge-led inquiry into the murder of ex-KGB agent Alexander Litvinenko may further "poison" ties between Moscow and London, Dmitry Peskov, a Kremlin spokesman, told reporters on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Britain's judge-led inquiry into the murder of ex-KGB agent Alexander Litvinenko may further "poison" ties between Moscow and London, Dmitry Peskov, a Kremlin spokesman, told reporters on Thursday.

headline.main: Kremlin Says British Litvinenko Murder Inquiry May Poison Ties
headline.print_headline: Kremlin Says British Litvinenko Murder Inquiry May Poison Ties

docs.snippet: Three Syrian asylum seekers who sought refuge in a church in Arctic Norway on Thursday, fearing that they could be deported back to Russia, can stay in the building, the parish council has decided....
docs.lead_paragraph: Three Syrian asylum seekers who sought refuge in a church in Arctic Norway on Thursday, fearing that they could be deported back to Russia, can stay in the building, the parish council has decided.

headline.main: Three Asylum Seekers From Syria Seek Refuge in Arctic Norway Church
headline.print_headline: Three Asylum Seekers From Syria Seek Refuge in Arctic Norway Church

docs.snippet: Turkish Prime Minister Ahmet Davutoglu accused Russia on Thursday of jeopardising peace talks on Syria planned for next week by insisting on the inclusion of "terrorist groups" such as the Kurdish YPG militia on the opposition side....

docs.snippet: Ukrainian prosecutors have launched a criminal investigation into the online publication by U.S. drinks companies Coca-Cola and Pepsico of a map that showed Crimea as a part of Russia, a Ukrainian lawmaker said on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Ukrainian prosecutors have launched a criminal investigation into the online publication by U.S. drinks companies Coca-Cola and Pepsico of a map that showed Crimea as a part of Russia, a Ukrainian lawmaker said on Thursday.

headline.main: Ukraine Investigates Coca-Cola and Pepsico Over Crimea Map Row: MP
headline.print_headline: Ukraine Investigates Coca-Cola and Pepsico Over Crimea Map Row: MP
